diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Gallstone pancreatitis s/p ERCP and laparoscopic cholecystectomy
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with epigastric pain, light-colored stools, dark urine, and pruritus, which suggested cholestasis. Elevated liver function tests supported the diagnosis of gallstone-related issues. ERCP findings confirmed the presence of stones in the common bile duct and cystic duct, leading to the diagnosis of gallstone pancreatitis.
